Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SpCrus6 (natural AMPs; crustin; Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; 4S=S; UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 38.6% similarity toCqCrs.Activity: Active against B. megaterium (MIC <0.8 uM), S. aureus (MIC <1.6 uM), and B. subtilis (MIC <3.1 uM), Gram-negative bacteria V-parahaemolyticus, V-alginolyticus, V-harveyi and E-coli (MIC >25 uM). Warning: text/table inconsistency: > or < in table but not in the text. The peptide is also able to agglutinate Gram+ bacteria (bacteria-agglutinating).Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: the peptide has been expressed in bacteria. Updated 8/2019; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Du ZQ, Wang Y, Ma HY, Shen XL, Wang K, Du J, Yu XD, Fang WH, Li XC.2018
Literature Information.Title: A new crustin homologue (SpCrus6) involved in the antimicrobial and antiviral innate immunity in mud crab, Scylla paramamosain.
